column4: Would running a LAMP setup, but only using it to test personal stuff, hog much memory?
depends a bit on what kind of stuff you intend to test.. but the basic apps won't use a lot of memory
I run lamp and some more stuff on a via mini-itx board with 512 MB memory.. it currently only uses about 100 MB for just running

Mainly small things like sweetcron, and maybe wordpress.  The only person seeing it will be me.  I guess my main question is, if nobody is going to it and it's just there ideling, will it take much memory?
Ah, alirght then.  I just did another fresh install, and want to keep it running as fast as I can. I too only have 512MB ram. :<
you can shut down the gui if you're not using it.. that saves quite a bit of memory
I didn't know there was a GUI? :x
ah.. you're running it on a ubuntu server install?
Ubuntu desktop, but installing apache/mysql/etc manually
I just use the regular desktop ubuntu.. so I shut down gnome when I don't use it
Aah, I gotcha, I thought you meant a GUI for a LAMP setup :p
ah.. nah.. I meant gnome and X
Does ctrl+alt+f1 "shut down" gnome, or just disable it until you bring it back? ;o
I usually access it using ssh so I just run "sudo /etc/init.d/gdm stop"
ah.. ctrl+alt+f1 just "hides" it.. it's still running
if you're worrying about memory footprint you might want to take a look at xubuntu.. it's a bit leaner
I'll look into it, then.  I can barely run songbird and firefox without my laptop wanting to crash.
